openemory Code Documentation¶

Accounts¶

This Django application is for functionality dealing with user accounts, such as custom authorization handling specific to openemory, as well as account-based views such as profile pages.

Auth¶

Utilities for dealing with authentiation & authorization in openemory.

Includes variant permisson-checing decorators without the redirect logic used in the standard Django versions, since openemory includes a login form on every page.

openemory.accounts.auth.login_required(function=None)[source]¶

Decorator for views that checks that the user is logged in, rendering a 401 or 403 template as appropriate. See user_passes_test_401_or_403().

openemory.accounts.auth.permission_required(perm)[source]¶

Decorator for views that checks whether a user has a particular permission enabled, rendering a 401 or 403 as necessary. Convenience wrapper for user_passes_test_401_or_403().

See django.contrib.auth.decorators.permission_required().

openemory.accounts.auth.require_self_or_admin(function=None)[source]¶

Check if user is logged and matches the specified username, is a superuser, or belongs to the SiteAdmin group.

First parameter to the wrapped view must be the username to compare against. For example:

@require_self_or_admin
def edit_profile(request, username):
    ...
openemory.accounts.auth.user_passes_test_401_or_403(test_func)[source]¶

View decorator that checks to see if the user passes the specified test. See django.contrib.auth.decorators.user_passes_test().

Anonymous users will be given a 401 error, which will render the 401.html template (which is expected to include the login form); logged in users that fail the test will be given a 403 error. In the case of a 403, the function will render the 403.html template.

Backends¶

class openemory.accounts.backends.FacultyOrLocalAdminBackend[source]¶

Customized authentication backend based on EmoryLDAPBackend. Only users who are designated as Faculty, in ESD or local users who are designated as superusers, Site Admins, or non-faculty with the nonfaculty_profile flag set are allowed to log in.

Db¶

class openemory.accounts.db.EsdRouter[source]¶

A database router to divert EsdPerson objects to the esd database.

Sync EsdPerson objects to the esd database.

db_for_read(model, **hints)[source]¶

Read EsdPerson objects from the esd database.

db_for_write(model, **hints)[source]¶

Write EsdPerson objects to the esd database.

class openemory.accounts.models.EsdPerson(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

A partial user profile from the external read-only ESD database. Users may be indexed by ppid or netid.

division_dept_id¶

Delimited field with division name and code, along with department name and id, so Departments and Divisions can be used with Solr facets but linked to the appropriate code or id. Uses the shortened name of the department.

faculty = <openemory.accounts.models.EsdFacultyManager object>¶

custom object manager for faculty persons only

first_name¶

First and middle name for indexing in Solr.

Uses firstmid_name when available; if empty, attempts to infer first name based on last_name and :attr`ad_name`.

has_profile_page()[source]¶

Return True if the user should have a public-facing web profile on the site, False if not. Currently requires Faculty status.

id¶

Id for use as Solr common id - ppid:P####, based on ppid.

index_data()[source]¶

Indexing information for this EsdPerson instance in a format that sunburnt.SolrInterface.add() can handle. If this person is internet or directory suppressed and does not have a local profile overridding that suppression, returns a dictionary with minimal information to be indexed. Otherwise, returns the item itself for sunburnt to inspect and index all fields that match fields in the Solr schema.

Returns:dict or EsdPerson
profile()[source]¶

Find the UserProfile corresponding to this EsdPerson.

record_type = 'accounts_esdperson'¶

record type for Solr index, to distinguish from other indexed content

username¶

Lower-case form of netid, for indexing in Solr.

class openemory.accounts.models.UserProfile(id, user, show_suppressed, nonfaculty_profile, photo, biography, phone, dept_num, full_name, title, employee_num, subdept_code, hr_id)[source]¶
esd_data()[source]¶

Find the EsdPerson corresponding to this profile.

get_full_name()[source]¶

Get full name from LDAP if available; returns django.contrib.auth.models.User.get_full_name() when full_name is not set in profile.

has_profile_page()[source]¶

Return True if the user should have a public-facing web profile on the site, False if not.

Currently only faculty or users with nonfaculty_profile flag = True have profiles.

recent_articles(limit=3)[source]¶

Query Solr to find recent articles by this author.

Parameters:limit – number of articles to return. (defaults to 3)
recent_articles_query()[source]¶

Return a Solr query for recent articles by this author. Use this if you want to further paginate or modify the article query: If you just want the articles themselves then use recent_articles().

resize_photo()[source]¶

Resize the photo associated with this profile (if any) to PHOTO_MAX_WIDTH, preserving aspect ratio. If the image width is already smaller than PHOTO_MAX_WIDTH, no changes are made.

suppress_esd_data¶

Boolean property to indicate whether ESD data can be shown (e.g., on a profile page), based on EsdPerson.internet_suppressed and EsdPerson.directory_suppressed flag and on the profile override flag, UserProfile.show_suppressed.

If True, ESD data should be suppressed. If False, ESD data can be displayed.

unpublished_articles()[source]¶

Query Solr to find unpublished articles by this author.

openemory.accounts.models.articles_by_tag(user, tag)[source]¶

Find articles in Solr based on a User and their Bookmark s.

Calls pids_by_tag() to find the pids of bookmarked objects for the specified user and tag, and then queries Solr to get display information for those objects.

openemory.accounts.models.pids_by_tag(user, tag)[source]¶

Find the pids of bookmarked objects for a given User and Tag. Returns a list of pids.

Parameters:
  • user – User whose Bookmark objects should be searched
  • tag – Tag tag to filter Bookmark objects
Returns:

list of pids
openemory.accounts.models.researchers_by_interest(name=None, slug=None)[source]¶

Find researchers by interest. Returns a QuerySet of User objects who have the specified interest tagged as a research interest on their profile. Allows searching by tag name or slug.

Parameters:
  • name – normal display name of the research interest tag
  • slug –

Views¶

openemory.accounts.views.admin_dashboard(request, *args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Admin dashboard to provide access to various admin functionality in one place. Based on the faculty dashboard.

openemory.accounts.views.dashboard_documents(request, *args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Display dashboard tab with documents for a logged-in faculty user looking at their own profile or a site admin looking at any faculty profile.

When requested via AJAX, returns HTML for the dashboard tab only; otherwise, returns the dashboard with tab content loaded.

openemory.accounts.views.dashboard_summary(request, *args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Display dashboard summary information for a logged-in faculty user looking at their own profile (or a site admin looking at any faculty profile).

When requested via AJAX, returns HTML for the dashboard tab only; otherwise, returns the dashboard with tab content loaded.

openemory.accounts.views.degree_autocomplete(request, mode)[source]¶

Auto-complete for Degree institutions and degree names.

Autocompletion is based on term query string parameter.

Parameters:mode – autocomplete mode - supported values are instutition or name
openemory.accounts.views.departments(request)[source]¶

List department names based on Faculty information in ESD, grouped by division name.

openemory.accounts.views.edit_profile(request, *args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Display and process profile edit form. On GET, displays the form; on POST, processes the form and saves if valid. Currently redirects to profile view on success.

When requested via AJAX, returns HTML that can be displayed in a dashboard tab; otherwise, returns the dashboard page with edit content loaded.

openemory.accounts.views.interests_autocomplete(request)[source]¶

Auto-complete for user profile research interests. Finds tags that are currently in use as UserProfile research interests.

See documentation on tag_autocompletion() for more details.

openemory.accounts.views.login(request)[source]¶

Log in, store credentials for Fedora access, and redirect to the user profile page if no next url was specified. If login fails, the user will be redirect either to the next url (if specified) or to the site index, with an error message to indicate the login failure.

Login functionality is based on eulfedora.views.login_and_store_credentials_in_session() and django.contrib.auth.views.login()

openemory.accounts.views.logout(request)[source]¶

Log out and redirect to the site index page.

openemory.accounts.views.object_tags(request, *args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Set & display private tags on a particular DigitalObject (saved in the database by way of Bookmark).

On an HTTP GET, returns a JSON list of the tags for the specified object, or 404 if the object has not been tagged.

On an HTTP PUT, will replace any existing tags with tags from the body of the request. Uses taggit.utils.parse_tags() to parse tags, with the same logic taggit uses for parsing keyword and phrase tags on forms. After a successul PUT, returns the a JSON response with a list of the updated tags. If the Fedora object does not exist, returns a 404 error.

openemory.accounts.views.position_autocomplete(request)[source]¶

Auto-complete for Position A.K.A. Institute Affiliations

Autocompletion is based on term query string parameter.

openemory.accounts.views.profile(request, *args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Display public profile information and publications for the requested author. Uses content negotation to provide equivalent content via RDF (see rdf_profile()).

If a logged in author or site admin looks at the profile, a dashboard view is displayed instead of the public profile information.

openemory.accounts.views.profile_tags(request, *args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Add & display tags (aka research interests) on a user profile.

On an HTTP GET, returns a JSON list of the tags for the specified user profile.

On an HTTP PUT, if the requesting user is logged in and adding tags to their own profile, will replace any existing tags with tags from the body of the request. Uses taggit.utils.parse_tags() to parse tags, with the same logic taggit uses for parsing keyword and phrase tags on forms. After a successul PUT, returns the a JSON response with the updated tags and their corresponding urls.

On an HTTP POST, performs the same tag parsing and permission checking as for PUT, but adds the POSTed tags to any existing tags instead of replacing them.

openemory.accounts.views.public_profile(request, username)[source]¶

Display public profile information and publications for the requested author.

When requested via AJAX, returns HTML that can be displayed inside a faculty dashboard tab.

openemory.accounts.views.rdf_profile(request, username)[source]¶

Profile information comparable to the human-readable content returned by profile(), but in RDF format.

openemory.accounts.views.researchers_by_interest(request, tag)[source]¶

Find users by research interest.

Parameters:tag – slug value for the research interest tag
openemory.accounts.views.tag_autocompletion(request, tag_qs, count_field)[source]¶

Common autocomplete functionality for tags. Given a Tag QuerySet and a field to count, returns a distinct list of the 10 most common tags filtered on the specified search term (case-insensitive). Results are returned as JSON, with a tag id (slug), display label (tag name and count), and the value to be used (tag name) for each matching tag found. Return format is suitable for use with JQuery UI Autocomplete widget.

Single term autocompletion is based on s query string parameter. If s is empty, this method will check for a term parameter and use taggit.utils.parse_tags() to do tag autocompletion on the last tag in a list of tags.

Parameters:
  • request – the http request passed to the original view method (used to retrieve the search term)
  • tag_qs – a Tag QuerySet filtered to the appropriate set of tags (for further filtering by search term)
  • count_field – field to be used for count annotation - used for tag ordering (most-used tags first) and display in the autocompletion
openemory.accounts.views.tags_autocomplete(request, *args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Auto-complete for private tags. Finds tags that the currently logged-in user has used for any of their Bookmark s.

See documentation on tag_autocompletion() for more details.

openemory.accounts.views.view_department(request, id)[source]¶

View a list of faculty (or non-faculty users with profiles) in a single department.

Parameters:id – department id

Template Tags & Filters¶

openemory.accounts.templatetags.tags.tags_for_user(object, user)[source]¶

Return a list of Tag objects for the specified object and user. Returns an empty list if the user is not authenticated, object does not have a pid, or no Bookmark record is found. Example use:

{% for tag in article|tags_for_user:user %}
  {{ tag.name }}{% if not forloop.last %}, {% endif %}
{% endfor %}
Parameters:
  • object – tagged, bookmarked object - can be anything with a pid attribute or a dictionary with a pid value (e.g., a DigitalObject or a sunburnt Solr result)
  • user – the user whose tags should be retrieved

Publication¶

This Django application handles the management of publications such as scholarly articles, including repository ingest, metadata editing, and basic access.

Models¶

class openemory.publication.models.ArticleRecord(id)[source]¶
class openemory.publication.models.ArticleStatistics(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Aggregated access statistics for a single Article. Subdivided by year and quarter to allow quarterly reporting.

class openemory.publication.models.FeaturedArticle(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

List of pid associated with article that are marked as Featured. One of these is selected at random and displayed on the homepage in the Slider.

class openemory.publication.models.NlmArticle(node=None, context=None, **kwargs)[source]¶

Minimal wrapper for NLM XML article

abstract = <eulxml.xmlmap.fields.NodeField>¶

article abstract

article_subtitle = <eulxml.xmlmap.fields.StringField>¶

subtitle of the article

article_title = <eulxml.xmlmap.fields.StringField>¶

title of the article, not including subtitle

authors = <eulxml.xmlmap.fields.NodeListField>¶

list of authors contributing to the article (list of NlmAuthor)

body = <eulxml.xmlmap.fields.NodeField>¶

preliminary mapping to article body (currently used to determine when full-text of the article is available)

corresponding_author_emails = <eulxml.xmlmap.fields.StringListField>¶

list of email addresses listed in article metadata for correspondence

docid = <eulxml.xmlmap.fields.IntegerField>¶

PMC document id from ESearchResponse; not PMID

doi = <eulxml.xmlmap.fields.StringField>¶

Digital Object Identifier (DOI) for the article

first_page = <eulxml.xmlmap.fields.StringField>¶

first page

fulltext_available¶

boolean; indicates whether or not the full text of the article is included in the fetched article.

identifiable_authors(refresh=False, derive=False)[source]¶

Identify any Emory authors for the article and, if possible, return a list of corresponding User objects. If derive is True it will try harder to match, it will try to derive based on netid and name.

Note

The current implementation is preliminary and has the following known limitations:

  • Ignores authors that are associated with Emory but do not have an Emory email address included in the article metadata
  • User look-up uses LDAP, which only finds authors who are currently associated with Emory

By default, caches the identified authors on the first look-up, in order to avoid unecessarily repeating LDAP queries.

identifiable_authors_email(refresh=False, derive=False)[source]¶

Identify any Emory authors for the article and, if possible, return a list of corresponding User objects. If derive is True it will try harder to match, it will try to derive based on netid and name.

Note

The current implementation is preliminary and has the following known limitations:

  • Ignores authors that are associated with Emory but do not have an Emory email address included in the article metadata
  • User look-up uses LDAP, which only finds authors who are currently associated with Emory

By default, caches the identified authors on the first look-up, in order to avoid unecessarily repeating LDAP queries.

issue = <eulxml.xmlmap.fields.StringField>¶

journal issue

journal_title = <eulxml.xmlmap.fields.StringField>¶

title of the journal that published the article

keywords = <eulxml.xmlmap.fields.StringListField>¶

keywords describing the content of the article

last_page = <eulxml.xmlmap.fields.StringField>¶

last page

pmid = <eulxml.xmlmap.fields.IntegerField>¶

PubMed id of the article

pubdates = <eulxml.xmlmap.fields.NodeListField>¶

Article publication dates as list of NlmPubDate.

publication_date¶

Article publication date as NlmPubDate. Looks for the article pub-date by type, and takes the first available of these, in this order: epub-ppub (both epub and ppub dates), ppub (print publication), epub (electronic publication).

publisher = <eulxml.xmlmap.fields.StringField>¶

journal publisher

sponsors = <eulxml.xmlmap.fields.StringListField>¶

Sponsor or funding group

volume = <eulxml.xmlmap.fields.StringField>¶

journal volume

class openemory.publication.models.Publication(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Subclass of DigitalObject to represent Scholarly Publications.

Following Hydra content model conventions where appropriate; similar to the generic simple Hydra content model genericContent.

aggregate_statistics()[source]¶

Get statistics for this article, aggregated across all available ArticleStatistics objects.

Returns:a dictionary with num_views and num_downloads members
as_rdf(node=None)[source]¶

Information about this Publication in RDF format. Currently, makes use of Bibliographic Ontology and FRBR.

Returns:instance of rdflib.graph.Graph
as_symp(source='manual', source_id=None)[source]¶

Takes an optional source param that will set the source in the SympRelation objects. source_id param that will set the source-id in the SympRelation objects. Returns a OESympImportPublication object and a list of SympRelation objects for use with Symplectic-Elements

authorAgreement¶

Optional authorAgreement datastream stores the authors’ agreement (if available) with the publisher.

collection¶

collection this object belongs to

contentMetadata¶

Optional datastream for additional content metadata for a scholarly article that is not the primary descriptive metadata as an NlmArticle.

descMetadata¶

Descriptive Metadata datastream, as PublicationMods

embargo_end¶

Return PublicationMods.embargo_end

embargo_end_date¶

Access PublicationMods.embargo_end on the local descMetadata datastream as a datetime.date instance.

from_symp()[source]¶

Modifies the current object and datastreams to be a Publication

image_cover()[source]¶

Generate a PDF cover page based on the MODS descriptive metadata associated with this article (descMetadata), using xhtml2pdf.

Returns:a cStringIO.StringIO with PDF content
image_with_cover()[source]¶

Return the PDF associated with this image (the contents of the png,jpeg datastream) with a custom cover page (generated by pdf_cover()).

index_data()[source]¶

Extend the default openemory.common.fedora.DigitalObject.index_data() method to include fields needed for search and display of Publication objects.

is_embargoed¶

boolean indicator that this publication is currently embargoed (i.e., there is an embargo end date set and that date is not in the past).

is_published¶

boolean indicator that this publication is currently published (currently defined as object by object state being active).

is_withdrawn¶

boolean indicator that this publication is currently withdrawn from the public-facing website.

number_of_pages¶

The number of pages in the PDF associated with this object

oai_itemID¶

OAI identifier

pdf¶

PDF content of a scholarly publication, stored and accessed as a FileDatastream; datastream is configured to be versioned and managed; default mimetype is application/pdf.

pdf_cover()[source]¶

Generate a PDF cover page based on the MODS descriptive metadata associated with this article (descMetadata), using xhtml2pdf.

Returns:a cStringIO.StringIO with PDF content
pdf_with_cover()[source]¶

Return the PDF associated with this article (the contents of the pdf datastream) with a custom cover page (generated by pdf_cover()).

Note

This method currently does not trap for errors such as pyPdf.util.PdfReadError or eulfedora.util.RequestFailed (e.g., if the datastream does not exist or cannot be accessed, or the datastream exists but the PDF is unreadable with pyPdf).

Returns:cStringIO.StringIO instance with the merged pdf content
provenance¶

Optional provenanceMetadata datastream for PREMIS Event metadata; datastream XML content will be an instance of PublicationPremis.

public_url¶

symplectic elements public url

save(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Extend default eulfedora.models.DigitalObject.save() to update a few fields before saving to Fedora.

  • set object owners based on ids from authors set in descMetadata content; if this would result in no owners, the previous value is left as is.
statistics(year=None, quarter=None)[source]¶

Get the ArticleStatistics for this object on the given year and / or quarter. If no year is specified, use the current year. If no quarter is specified, use the current quarter. Returns None if this article does not yet have a PID.

statistics_queryset()[source]¶

Get a QuerySet for all this article’s ArticleStatistics. Returns None if this article does not yet have a PID.

sympAtom¶

Descriptive Metadata datastream, as PublicationMods

zip_with_cover()[source]¶

Return the zip associated with this publication (the contents of the zip is excel,powerpoint,word datastream) with a custom cover page (generated by pdf_cover()).

class openemory.publication.models.PublicationPremis(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Extend eulxml.xmlmap.premis.Premis to add convenience mappings to admin review event, review date, harvest event, harvest date, upload event, date uploaded.

harvested(user, pmcid)[source]¶

Add an event to indicate that this article has been harvested. Wrapper for premis_event()

Parameters:
  • user – the User who harvested the article
  • pmcid – the pmcid of the article in PubMed Central
merged(original_pid, element_pid)[source]¶

Add an event to indicate that this article has been reviewed. Wrapper for premis_event()

Parameters:reviewer – the User who reviewed the article
premis_event(user, type, detail)[source]¶

Perform the common logic when creating premeis events. A KeyError Exception will be raised if the type is not in the list of allowed types.

Parameters:
  • user – the User who is performing the action.
  • type –

    the type of event. Currently the allowed values are:

    • review
    • harvest
    • upload
    • withdraw
    • reinstate
    • merge
  • detail – detail message for event`
reinstated(user, reason=None)[source]¶

Add an event to indicate that this article has been reinstated to the public-facing collection by a site administrator (after a past withdrawal).

Parameters:
  • user – the User who reinstated the article
  • reason – optional user-entered string explaining the reason for reinstatement, to be included in the event detail
reviewed(reviewer)[source]¶

Add an event to indicate that this article has been reviewed. Wrapper for premis_event()

Parameters:reviewer – the User who reviewed the article
symp_ingest(user, id)[source]¶

Add an event to indicate that this article has been ingested from Symplectic-Elements. Wrapper for premis_event()

Parameters:id – the id of the article in Symplectic-Elements
uploaded(user, legal_statement=None)[source]¶

Add an event to indicate that this article has been uploaded. Wrapper for premis_event()

Parameters:
  • user – the User who uploaded the file
  • legal_statement – string representing form of agreement indicated by user: ‘AUTHOR’ for agreement to author’s Assent to Deposit; ‘MEDIATED’ for agreement to admin Mediated Deposit statement. This value should never be left as the default None: This will generate a statement that the item was uploaded without the user agreeing to a rights statement.
withdrawn(user, reason)[source]¶

Add an event to indicate that this article has been withdrawn from the public-facing collection by a site administrator.

Parameters:
  • user – the User who withdrew the article
  • reason – user-entered string explaining the reason for withdrawal, to be included in the event detail

Wrapper-class for access to UMI/ProQuest research fields (also known as Subject Categories).

as_category_completion()[source]¶

Flatten the SKOS hierarchy into a list of dictionaries that can be used as the basis for a category-based jQueryUI autocomplete (see http://jqueryui.com/demos/autocomplete/#categories ).

as_field_choices()[source]¶

Generate and a list of choices, based on the SKOS collection hierarchy, that can be used with a django.forms.ChoiceField.

Initialize and return CodeList instance from the MARC languages Code List.

openemory.publication.models.year_quarter(month)[source]¶

Returns the quarter the year based on month param. For example month 2 would return 1, month 4 would return 2

Views¶

openemory.publication.views.audit_trail(request, *args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Access XML audit trail on openemory.publication.model.Article objects

openemory.publication.views.bibliographic_metadata(request, pid)[source]¶

Return bibliographic metadata for an article. Currently this view is used primarily to support import to EndNote, though it may be extended to support other formats in the future.

openemory.publication.views.browse_field(request, field)[source]¶

Browse a list of values for a specific field, e.g. authors, subjects, or journal titles. Displays a list of values for the specified field with a count for the number of articles associated with the particular author, subject, or journal, and a link to a search for articles with the specified field and value.

Parameters:field – Expected to be one of authors, subjects, or journals
openemory.publication.views.departments(request)[source]¶

List department names based on article information in solr, grouped by division name.

openemory.publication.views.download_pdf(request, pid)[source]¶

View to allow access the All datastream of a openemory.publication.models.Publication object. Sets a content-disposition header that will prompt the file to be saved with a default title based on the object label.

Returns the original Publication Mime Type with a cover page, if possible; if there is an error generating the cover page version of the PDF, the original PDF will be returned.

openemory.publication.views.edit_metadata(request, *args, **kwargs)[source]¶

View to edit the metadata for an existing Article .

On GET, display the form. When valid form data is POSTed, updates thes object.

openemory.publication.views.ingest(request, *args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Create a new Article object and ingest into the repository one of two ways:

  • By uploading a file from a web form. On GET, displays the upload form. On POST with a valid file, ingests the content into Fedora.
  • When a request is POSTed via AJAX, looks for a pmcid in the request to find the HarvestRecord to be ingested. Requires site admin permissions.

Sends a message to the managers, as defined by the MANAGERS setting.

Return the last modification date for an object in Fedora, to allow for conditional processing with use with django.views.decorators.last_modified().

openemory.publication.views.site_index(request)[source]¶

openemory.publication.views.suggest_from_solr(request, field)[source]¶

Suggest terms based on a specified field and term prefix, using Solr facets. Returns a JSON response with the 15 most common matching terms in the requested field with the specified prefix.

Note

Due to the current implementation and the limitations of facet querying in Solr, the search term is case-sensitive and only matches at the beginning of the string.

Return format is suitable for use with JQuery UI Autocomplete widget.

Parameters:
  • request – the http request passed to the original view method (used to retrieve the search term)
  • field – the name of the field to query in Solr (without the _facet portion). Currently supported fields: author_affiliation, funder, journal_publisher, keyword
openemory.publication.views.summary(request)[source]¶

Publication summary page with a list of most downloaded and most recent content.

Harvest¶

This Django application deals with harvesting content from other sources for potential ingest into the OpenEmory repository, along with administrative functionality for managing the queue of harvested records.

Models¶

class openemory.harvest.models.HarvestRecord(id, pmcid, title, harvested, status, fulltext, content)[source]¶

Direct link to this PubMed Central article, based on PubMed Central ID.

Returns:unsaved Article

Boolean; indicates of this record is in an accetable status for ingest.?

Mark this record as ignored (will not be ingested into the repository0. Updates the status and removes the harvestd Article xml file.

Mark this record as in process for ingest by another process to minimize the chances of accidentally ingesting an object twice.

Mark this record as ingested into the repository. Updates the status and removes the harvestd Article xml file.

Misc.¶

SHERPA/RoMEO¶

SHERPA/RoMEO API access

This module provides access to the SHERPA/RoMEO publisher copyright policy database through its web API. The API provides seven basic search types, which are exposed here as functions:

  • search_publisher_name()
  • search_publisher_id()
  • search_journal_title()
  • search_journal_followup()
  • search_journal_issn()
  • all_publishers()
  • search_colour()

The SHERPA/RoMEO API returns XML responses. This module wraps those in XmlObject instances:

  • Response
  • Journal
  • Publisher
  • Mandate
  • Copyright

Note that we follow the SHERPA/RoMEO spelling of colour where it appears in this module.

funder_info¶

Query functions in this module all take an optional funder_info argument. If the argument is something other than 'none' (the default), then Publisher objects in the response will include Mandate details for the funders matching the argument value. SHERPA/RoMEO accepts the following values:

  • 'none': Include no Mandate details
  • 'all': Include all Mandate details for this Publisher
  • a funder’s full case-insensitive name from JULIET: Include Mandate details for the named funder
  • a funder’s case-insensitive acronym from JULIET: Include Mandate details for the first funder matching the specified acronym
  • a funder’s JULIET PID: Include Mandate details for the identified funder
  • a iso-3166 two-letter country code: Include Mandate details for funding by the identified country
openemory.common.romeo.search_publisher_name(name, type=None, versions=None, funder_info=None)[source]¶

Search for a publisher by name.

Parameters:
  • name – string of words in the name
  • type – 'all' to search for all tokens in any order; 'any' to search for one or more tokens in any order; 'exact' to search for the name as a case-insensitive substring of the publisher name. defaults to 'all'
  • versions – 'all' to include publisher policies for all available versions. Without this, PDF policy information will not be included
  • funder_info – see module notes on funder_info
Return type:

list of matching Publisher objects
openemory.common.romeo.search_publisher_id(id, versions=None, funder_info=None)[source]¶

Search for a publisher by SHERPA/RoMEO id.

Parameters:
  • id – a SHERPA/RoMEO identifier
  • funder_info – see module notes on funder_info
Return type:

matching Publisher, or None
openemory.common.romeo.search_journal_title(name, type=None, versions=None, funder_info=None)[source]¶

Search for a journal by title.

Parameters:
  • name – string
  • type – 'starts' to search for journals starting with name; 'contains' to search for journals containing name as a substring`; 'exact' for a case-insensitive exact match with name. defaults to 'starts'.
  • versions – 'all' to include publisher policies for all available versions. Without this, PDF policy information will not be included
  • funder_info – see module notes on funder_info
Return type:

list of Journal objects
openemory.common.romeo.search_journal_followup(name, publisher_zetoc, publisher_romeo, issn=None, versions=None, funder_info=None)[source]¶

Search for a single journal by title and publisher name.

Parameters:
  • name – string
  • publisher_zetoc – publisher name in ZETOC database
  • publisher_romeo – publisher name in RoMEO database
  • issn – journal ISSN
  • versions – 'all' to include publisher policies for all available versions. Without this, PDF policy information will not be included
  • funder_info – see module notes on funder_info
Return type:

Journal or None

  • versions – 'all' to include publisher policies for all available versions. Without this, PDF policy information will not be included

RDF namespaces¶

RDF Namespaces initialized as instances of rdflib.Namespace, along with namespace prefixes, for use accessing and generating RDF content throughout the application.

openemory.rdfns.BIBO = Namespace(u'http://purl.org/ontology/bibo/')¶

Bibliographic Ontology

openemory.rdfns.DC = Namespace(u'http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/')¶

Dublin Core

openemory.rdfns.FOAF = Namespace(u'http://xmlns.com/foaf/0.1/')¶

Friend-of-a-Friend

openemory.rdfns.FRBR = Namespace(u'http://purl.org/vocab/frbr/core#')¶

Functional Requirements for Bibliographic Records (FRBR core)

openemory.rdfns.ns_prefixes = {'foaf': Namespace(u'http://xmlns.com/foaf/0.1/'), 'frbr': Namespace(u'http://purl.org/vocab/frbr/core#'), 'dc': Namespace(u'http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/'), 'bibo': Namespace(u'http://purl.org/ontology/bibo/')}¶

Prefixes for RDF Namespaces defined here in openemory.rdfns, for consistency in serializing RDF content throughout the application. To use, bind each prefixes and corresponding namespace to your graph:

rdf = rdflib.graph.Graph()
for prefix, ns in ns_prefixes.iteritems():
   rdf.bind(prefix, ns)
